abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Russian Federation
            Education Reform Project were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was low or
            negligible, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: 1) the project has generated a large knowledge
            base of high quality and relevance that could prove to be
            valuable for promoting similar reforms elsewhere -- so
            projects should strive to publish project related studies
            and reports; 2) while designing reform oriented projects it
            is important to take up a set of complementary reforms
            rather than focusing on only most important reforms; and 3)
            while designing projects it is critical to carefully analyze
            project activities that could be better implemented by outsourcing.
